title.en: Chronicle of Feudal Lords since the Han Founding

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：殷以前尚矣。

translations.literal: Grand Historian said: Yin before still ancient.
translations.idiomatic: Grand Historian said: Yin before still ancient. (translated).

sentences.zh: 周封五等：公，侯，伯，子，男。

translations.literal: Zhou enfeoffed five ranks: duke, marquis, earl, viscount, baron.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou enfeoffed five ranks: duke, marquis, earl, viscount, baron. (translated).

sentences.zh: 然封伯禽、康叔於魯、衛，地各四百里，親親之義，褒有德也；

translations.literal: However enfeoffed Bo Qin, Kang Shu at Lu, Wei, territories each four hundred li, love relatives principle, praise have virtue also;
translations.idiomatic: However enfeoffed Bo Qin, Kang Shu at Lu, Wei, territories each four hundred li, love relatives principle, praise have virtue also; (translated).

sentences.zh: 太公於齊，兼五侯地，尊勤勞也。

translations.literal: Tai Gong at Qi, combined five marquises territory, honor diligent labor also.
translations.idiomatic: Tai Gong at Qi, combined five marquises territory, honor diligent labor also. (translated).

sentences.zh: 武王、成、康所封數百，而同姓五十五，地上不過百里，下三十里，以輔衛王室。

translations.literal: Wu Wang, Cheng, Kang enfeoffed several hundred, while same surname fifty-five, territory top not exceed hundred li, bottom thirty li, to assist protect royal house.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Wang, Cheng, Kang enfeoffed several hundred, while same surname fifty-five, territory top not exceed hundred li, bottom thirty li, to assist protect royal house. (translated).

sentences.zh: 管、蔡、康叔、曹、鄭，或過或損。

translations.literal: Guan, Cai, Kang Shu, Cao, Zheng, some exceed some reduce.
translations.idiomatic: Guan, Cai, Kang Shu, Cao, Zheng, some exceed some reduce. (translated).

sentences.zh: 厲、幽之後，王室缺，侯伯彊國興焉，天子微，弗能正。

translations.literal: Li, You after, royal house deficient, marquises earls strong states rise there, Son of Heaven weak, not able correct.
translations.idiomatic: Li, You after, royal house deficient, marquises earls strong states rise there, Son of Heaven weak, not able correct. (translated).

sentences.zh: 非德不純，形勢弱也。

translations.literal: Not virtue not pure, strategic position weak also.
translations.idiomatic: Not virtue not pure, strategic position weak also. (translated).

translations.literal: Sima Qian said: The Yin and earlier periods are still remote. The Zhou enfeoffed five ranks of nobility: dukes, marquises, earls, viscounts, and barons. Yet they enfeoffed Bo Qin and Kang Shu at Lu and Wei, each with four hundred li of territory, demonstrating the principle of favoring relatives and rewarding those with virtue; Tai Gong at Qi was given land combining five marquises' territories, honoring his diligent service. Kings Wu, Cheng, and Kang enfeoffed several hundred nobles, with fifty-five being paternal relatives, their territories ranging from no more than one hundred li down to thirty li, to support and protect the royal house. Guan, Cai, Kang Shu, Cao, and Zheng - some were given more territory, others less. After the reigns of Kings Li and You, the royal house declined, and powerful states ruled by marquises and earls arose. The Son of Heaven grew weak and could no longer control them. It was not that their virtue was impure, but that their position was weak.

sentences.zh: 漢興，序二等。

translations.literal: Han rose, ranked two grades.
translations.idiomatic: Han rose, ranked two grades. (translated).

sentences.zh: 高祖末年，非劉氏而王者，若無功上所不置而侯者，天下共誅之。

translations.literal: Gao Zu end years, not Liu clan while king ones, if no merit emperor not establish while marquis ones, world together execute them.
translations.idiomatic: Gao Zu end years, not Liu clan while king ones, if no merit emperor not establish while marquis ones, world together execute them. (translated).

sentences.zh: 高祖子弟同姓為王者九國，雖獨長沙異姓，而功臣侯者百有餘人。

translations.literal: Gao Zu sons brothers same surname become kings nine states, although only Changsha different surname, while meritorious ministers marquis ones hundred plus persons.
translations.idiomatic: Gao Zu sons brothers same surname become kings nine states, although only Changsha different surname, while meritorious ministers marquis ones hundred plus persons. (translated).

sentences.zh: 自雁門、太原以東至遼陽，為燕代國；

translations.literal: From Yanmen, Taiyuan east to Liaoyang, became Yan Dai states;
translations.idiomatic: From Yanmen, Taiyuan east to Liaoyang, became Yan Dai states; (translated).

sentences.zh: 常山以南，大行左轉，度河、濟，阿、甄以東薄海，為齊、趙國；

translations.literal: Changshan south, Taihang left turn, cross Yellow River, Ji, A, Zhen east reach sea, became Qi, Zhao states;
translations.idiomatic: Changshan south, Taihang left turn, cross Yellow River, Ji, A, Zhen east reach sea, became Qi, Zhao states; (translated).

sentences.zh: 自陳以西，南至九疑，東帶江、淮、谷、泗，薄會稽，為梁、楚、淮南、長沙國：皆外接於胡、越。

translations.literal: From Chen west, south to Jiuyi, east border Jiang, Huai, Gu, Si, reach Kuaiji, became Liang, Chu, Huainan, Changsha states: all externally connect to Hu, Yue.
translations.idiomatic: From Chen west, south to Jiuyi, east border Jiang, Huai, Gu, Si, reach Kuaiji, became Liang, Chu, Huainan, Changsha states: all externally connect to Hu, Yue. (translated).

sentences.zh: 而內地北距山以東盡諸侯地，大者或五六郡，連城數十，置百官宮觀，僭於天子。

translations.literal: While inner lands north border mountains east exhaust feudal lords territories, large ones or five six commanderies, connected cities dozens, established hundred officials palaces temples, presumptuously toward Son of Heaven.
translations.idiomatic: While inner lands north border mountains east exhaust feudal lords territories, large ones or five six commanderies, connected cities dozens, established hundred officials palaces temples, presumptuously toward Son of Heaven. (translated).

sentences.zh: 漢獨有三河、東郡、潁川、南陽，自江陵以西至蜀，北自雲中至隴西，與內史凡十五郡，而公主列侯頗食邑其中。

translations.literal: Han alone had Sanhe, Dongjun, Yingchuan, Nanyang, from Jiangling west to Shu, north from Yunzhong to Longxi, with inner minister altogether fifteen commanderies, while princesses marquises considerably eat fiefs therein.
translations.idiomatic: Han alone had Sanhe, Dongjun, Yingchuan, Nanyang, from Jiangling west to Shu, north from Yunzhong to Longxi, with inner minister altogether fifteen commanderies, while princesses marquises considerably eat fiefs therein. (translated).

sentences.zh: 何者？

translations.literal: Why?
translations.idiomatic: Why? (translated).

sentences.zh: 天下初定，骨肉同姓少，故廣彊庶孽，以鎮撫四海，用承衛天子也。

translations.literal: World initially pacified, close relatives same surname few, therefore extensively strengthened collateral branches, to pacify stabilize four seas, used to support protect Son of Heaven also.
translations.idiomatic: World initially pacified, close relatives same surname few, therefore extensively strengthened collateral branches, to pacify stabilize four seas, used to support protect Son of Heaven also. (translated).

translations.literal: When the Han arose, they established two ranks of nobility. In the later years of Gaozu's reign, anyone not of the Liu clan who became king, or who became a marquis without merit and without imperial approval, would be executed by all under heaven. Gaozu's sons and younger brothers of the same surname who became kings numbered nine states, and though only Changsha was of a different surname, there were more than a hundred meritorious ministers who became marquises. From Yanmen and Taiyuan eastward to Liaoyang became the Yan and Dai states; South of Mount Chang, where the Great Wall turns left, crossing the Yellow River and Ji Rivers, from E and Zhen eastward to the sea became the Qi and Zhao states; From Chen westward, south to the Nine Doubts Mountains, east along the Jiang, Huai, Gu, and Si Rivers, bordering Kuaiji, became the Liang, Chu, Huainan, and Changsha states: all bordering externally on the Hu and Yue barbarians. As for the inner lands north of the mountains eastward, all were the territories of feudal lords. The largest domains encompassed five or six commanderies, with dozens of connected cities. They established hundreds of officials and built palaces and observatories that rivaled the Son of Heaven. The Han alone controlled Sanhe, Dongjun, Yingchuan, and Nanyang commanderies, stretching from Jiangling westward to Shu and northward from Yunzhong to Longxi. Together with the capital region, this made fifteen commanderies in total. Many princesses and marquises also held fiefs within these territories. Why was this so? When the realm was first pacified, there were few close relatives of the same surname, so the emperor strengthened collateral branches of the family to maintain control over the four seas and support the Son of Heaven.

sentences.zh: 漢定百年之閒，親屬益疏，諸侯或驕奢，忕邪臣計謀為淫亂，大者叛逆，小者不軌于法，以危其命，殞身亡國。

translations.literal: Han pacified hundred years interval, relatives increasingly distant, feudal lords some arrogant extravagant, followed evil ministers schemed for lewd disorder, large ones rebelled, small ones not followed by law, to endanger their lives, perished bodies lost states.
translations.idiomatic: Han pacified hundred years interval, relatives increasingly distant, feudal lords some arrogant extravagant, followed evil ministers schemed for lewd disorder, large ones rebelled, small ones not followed by law, to endanger their lives, perished bodies lost states. (translated).

sentences.zh: 天子觀於上古，然後加惠，使諸侯得推恩分子弟國邑，故齊分為七，趙分為六，梁分為五，淮南分三，及天子支庶子為王，王子支庶為侯，百有餘焉。

translations.literal: Son of Heaven observed ancient times, then added favor, caused feudal lords able extend favor divide sons brothers state cities, therefore Qi divided into seven, Zhao into six, Liang into five, Huainan into three, and Son of Heaven collateral sons become kings, kings collateral sons become marquises, hundred plus thereupon.
translations.idiomatic: Son of Heaven observed ancient times, then added favor, caused feudal lords able extend favor divide sons brothers state cities, therefore Qi divided into seven, Zhao into six, Liang into five, Huainan into three, and Son of Heaven collateral sons become kings, kings collateral sons become marquises, hundred plus thereupon. (translated).

sentences.zh: 吳楚時，前后諸侯或以適削地，是以燕、代無北邊郡，吳、淮南、長沙無南邊郡，齊、趙、梁、楚支郡名山陂海咸納於漢。

translations.literal: Wu Chu time, before after feudal lords some because crimes reduced territories, therefore Yan, Dai no northern border commanderies, Wu, Huainan, Changsha no southern border commanderies, Qi, Zhao, Liang, Chu branch commanderies famous mountains ponds seas all submitted to Han.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Chu time, before after feudal lords some because crimes reduced territories, therefore Yan, Dai no northern border commanderies, Wu, Huainan, Changsha no southern border commanderies, Qi, Zhao, Liang, Chu branch commanderies famous mountains ponds seas all submitted to Han. (translated).

sentences.zh: 諸侯稍微，大國不過十餘城，小侯不過數十里，上足以奉貢職，下足以供養祭祀，以蕃輔京師。

translations.literal: Feudal lords slightly weakened, large states not exceed ten plus cities, small marquises not exceed several ten li, above sufficient pay tribute duties, below sufficient supply support sacrifices, to multiply assist capital.
translations.idiomatic: Feudal lords slightly weakened, large states not exceed ten plus cities, small marquises not exceed several ten li, above sufficient pay tribute duties, below sufficient supply support sacrifices, to multiply assist capital. (translated).

sentences.zh: 而漢郡八九十，形錯諸侯閒，犬牙相臨，秉其阸塞地利，彊本干，弱枝葉之勢，尊卑明而萬事各得其所矣。

translations.literal: While Han commanderies eighty ninety, interlocked feudal lords between, interlocking teeth mutually adjacent, grasped their strategic passes terrain advantages, strengthened trunk root, weakened branches leaves posture, honor low clear and myriad matters each obtained their place.
translations.idiomatic: While Han commanderies eighty ninety, interlocked feudal lords between, interlocking teeth mutually adjacent, grasped their strategic passes terrain advantages, strengthened trunk root, weakened branches leaves posture, honor low clear and myriad matters each obtained their place. (translated).

translations.literal: After a century of Han rule, family ties grew distant. Some feudal lords became arrogant and extravagant, swayed by slandering ministers who schemed for chaos. The greater lords rebelled, the lesser ones broke the law, endangering their lives and leading to their destruction and the loss of their states. The Son of Heaven, observing ancient precedents, then showed favor by allowing feudal lords to extend grace to their younger sons and divide their territories among them. Thus Qi was divided into seven parts, Zhao into six, Liang into five, and Huainan into three. Even the Son of Heaven's collateral sons became kings, and kings' collateral sons became marquises - more than a hundred in total. During the Wu and Chu rebellions, successive feudal lords lost territories due to their transgressions. Thus Yan and Dai had no northern border commanderies, while Wu, Huainan, and Changsha had no southern border commanderies. The branch commanderies of Qi, Zhao, Liang, and Chu - with their famous mountains, dikes, and coastal regions - all reverted to Han control. The power of the feudal lords was gradually diminished. The greatest states controlled no more than ten or so cities, while the smallest marquises held no more than several dozen li of territory. This was enough to fulfill their tribute obligations above and maintain sacrificial rites below, while guarding and supporting the capital. The Han controlled eighty to ninety commanderies, interspersed among the feudal territories like interlocking dog teeth. They controlled the strategic passes and terrain advantages, strengthening the trunk while weakening the branches and leaves. Thus the hierarchy was clear and everything fell into its proper place.

sentences.zh: 臣遷謹記高祖以來至太初諸侯，譜其下益損之時，令時世得覽。

translations.literal: Minister Qian respectfully records Gao Zu since to Tai Chu feudal lords, tabulated their below increase decrease times, caused age world able view.
translations.idiomatic: Minister Qian respectfully records Gao Zu since to Tai Chu feudal lords, tabulated their below increase decrease times, caused age world able view. (translated).

sentences.zh: 形勢雖彊，要之以仁義為本。

translations.literal: Strategic position although strong, essential with benevolence righteousness as foundation.
translations.idiomatic: Strategic position although strong, essential with benevolence righteousness as foundation. (translated).

translations.literal: I, Qian, respectfully record the feudal lords from Gaozu's time until the Tai Chu era, charting the times when their territories increased or decreased, so that the present age may view them. Though the strategic position was strong, benevolence and righteousness were essential as its foundation.

cells.content: 十一月，初王韓信元年。都馬邑。
cells.literal: Eleventh month, first king Han Xin first year. Capital Mayi.
cells.idiomatic: Eleventh month, first king Han Xin first year. Capital Mayi. (translated).

cells.literal: First year of King Xin. Former Chancellor.
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Xin. Former Chancellor. (translated).

cells.content: 十月乙丑，初王英布元年。
cells.literal: Tenth month, yi-chou day, first year of King Ying Bu.
cells.idiomatic: Tenth month, yi-chou day, first year of King Ying Bu. (translated).

cells.literal: First year of King Zhang Er. Died.
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Zhang Er. Died. (translated).

cells.content: 齊王信徙為楚王元年。反，廢。
cells.literal: First year of King Xin of Qi transferred to become King of Chu. Rebelled, deposed.
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Xin of Qi transferred to become King of Chu. Rebelled, deposed. (translated).

cells.content: 後九月壬子，初王盧綰元年。
cells.literal: Later ninth month, ren-zi day, first year of King Lu Wan.
cells.idiomatic: Later ninth month, ren-zi day, first year of King Lu Wan. (translated).

cells.literal: First year of King Ao. Ao was Er's son.
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Ao. Ao was Er's son. (translated).

cells.literal: First year of King Peng Yue
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Peng Yue (translated).

cells.literal: Four. Surrendered to Xiongnu, kingdom abolished and made into a commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Four. Surrendered to Xiongnu, kingdom abolished and made into a commandery. (translated).

cells.content: 二月乙未，初王文王吳芮元年。薨。
cells.literal: Second month, yi-wei day, first year of King Wen Wang Wu Rui. Died.
cells.idiomatic: Second month, yi-wei day, first year of King Wen Wang Wu Rui. Died. (translated).

cells.content: 正月丙午，初王交元年。交，高祖弟。
cells.literal: First month, bing-wu day, first year of King Jiao. Jiao was Gaozu's younger brother.
cells.idiomatic: First month, bing-wu day, first year of King Jiao. Jiao was Gaozu's younger brother. (translated).

cells.content: 正月甲子，初王悼惠王肥元年。肥，高祖子。
cells.literal: First month, jia-zi day, first year of King Dao Hui Wang Fei. Fei was Gaozu's son.
cells.idiomatic: First month, jia-zi day, first year of King Dao Hui Wang Fei. Fei was Gaozu's son. (translated).

cells.content: 正月丙午，初王劉賈元年。
cells.literal: First month, bing-wu day, first year of King Liu Jia.
cells.idiomatic: First month, bing-wu day, first year of King Liu Jia. (translated).

cells.literal: First year of King Cheng Wang Chen
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Cheng Wang Chen (translated).

cells.content: 初王隱王如意元年。如意，高祖子。
cells.literal: First year of King Yin Wang Ruyi. Ruyi was Gaozu's son.
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Yin Wang Ruyi. Ruyi was Gaozu's son. (translated).

cells.literal: Seven. Came to court. Rebelled, executed.
cells.idiomatic: Seven. Came to court. Rebelled, executed. (translated).

cells.literal: Six. Came to court. Rebelled, executed.
cells.idiomatic: Six. Came to court. Rebelled, executed. (translated).

cells.content: 六。為英布所殺，國除為郡。
cells.literal: Six. Killed by Ying Bu, kingdom abolished and made into a commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Six. Killed by Ying Bu, kingdom abolished and made into a commandery. (translated).

cells.content: 十二月庚午，厲王長元年。長，高祖子。
cells.literal: Twelfth month, geng-wu day, first year of King Li Wang Chang. Chang was Gaozu's son.
cells.idiomatic: Twelfth month, geng-wu day, first year of King Li Wang Chang. Chang was Gaozu's son. (translated).

cells.content: 二月丙午，初王恢元年。恢，高祖子。
cells.literal: Second month, bing-wu day, first year of King Hui. Hui was Gaozu's son.
cells.idiomatic: Second month, bing-wu day, first year of King Hui. Hui was Gaozu's son. (translated).

cells.content: 三月丙寅，初王友元年。友，高祖子。
cells.literal: Third month, bing-yin day, first year of King You. You was Gaozu's son.
cells.idiomatic: Third month, bing-yin day, first year of King You. You was Gaozu's son. (translated).

cells.literal: First month, bing-zi day, first year of King Chu.
cells.idiomatic: First month, bing-zi day, first year of King Chu. (translated).

cells.content: 更為吳國。十月辛丑，初王濞元年。濞，高祖兄仲子，故沛侯。
cells.literal: Changed to Wu kingdom. Tenth month, xin-chou day, first year of King Pi. Pi was Gaozu's elder brother Zhong's son, former Marquis of Pei.
cells.idiomatic: Changed to Wu kingdom. Tenth month, xin-chou day, first year of King Pi. Pi was Gaozu's elder brother Zhong's son, former Marquis of Pei. (translated).

cells.content: 二月甲午，初王靈王建元年。建，高祖子。
cells.literal: Second month, jia-wu day, first year of King Ling Wang Jian. Jian was Gaozu's son.
cells.idiomatic: Second month, jia-wu day, first year of King Ling Wang Jian. Jian was Gaozu's son. (translated).

cells.content: 淮陽王徙於趙，名友，元年。是為幽王。
cells.literal: King of Huaiyang transferred to Zhao, named You, first year. This was King You.
cells.idiomatic: King of Huaiyang transferred to Zhao, named You, first year. This was King You. (translated).

cells.literal: First year of King Ai Hui
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Ai Hui (translated).

cells.literal: First year of King Ai Xiang
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Ai Xiang (translated).

cells.content: 四月初王張偃元年。偃，高后外孫，故趙王敖子。
cells.literal: Fourth month, first year of King Zhang Yan. Yan was Empress Gao's grandson, former Zhao King Zhu's son.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month, first year of King Zhang Yan. Yan was Empress Gao's grandson, former Zhao King Zhu's son. (translated).

cells.content: 四月辛卯，哀王不疑元年。薨。
cells.literal: Fourth month, xin-mao day, first year of King Ai Buyi. Died.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month, xin-mao day, first year of King Ai Buyi. Died. (translated).

cells.content: 四月辛卯，呂王台元年。薨。
cells.literal: Fourth month, xin-mao day, first year of King Lu Tai. Died.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month, xin-mao day, first year of King Lu Tai. Died. (translated).

cells.content: 四月辛卯，初王懷王強元年。強，惠帝子。
cells.literal: Fourth month, xin-mao day, first year of King Huai Wang Qiang. Qiang was Emperor Hui's son.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month, xin-mao day, first year of King Huai Wang Qiang. Qiang was Emperor Hui's son. (translated).

cells.content: 七月癸巳，初王義元年。哀王弟。義，孝惠子，故襄城侯，立為帝。
cells.literal: Seventh month, gui-si day, first year of King Yi. King Ai's younger brother. Yi was Emperor Xiaohui's son, former Marquis of Xiangcheng, enthroned as emperor.
cells.idiomatic: Seventh month, gui-si day, first year of King Yi. King Ai's younger brother. Yi was Emperor Xiaohui's son, former Marquis of Xiangcheng, enthroned as emperor. (translated).

cells.content: 十一月癸亥，王呂嘉元年。嘉，肅王子。
cells.literal: Eleventh month, gui-hai day, first year of King Lu Jia. Jia was King Su's son.
cells.idiomatic: Eleventh month, gui-hai day, first year of King Lu Jia. Jia was King Su's son. (translated).

cells.literal: First year of King Gong You
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Gong You (translated).

cells.content: 五月丙辰，初王朝元年。朝，惠帝子，故軹侯。
cells.literal: Fifth month, bing-chen day, first year of King Chao. Chao was Emperor Hui's son, former Marquis of Zhi.
cells.idiomatic: Fifth month, bing-chen day, first year of King Chao. Chao was Emperor Hui's son, former Marquis of Zhi. (translated).

cells.content: 嘉廢。七月丙辰，呂產元年。產，肅王弟，故洨侯。
cells.literal: Jia deposed. Seventh month, bing-chen day, first year of Lu Chan. Chan was King Su's younger brother, former Marquis of Xiao.
cells.idiomatic: Jia deposed. Seventh month, bing-chen day, first year of Lu Chan. Chan was King Su's younger brother, former Marquis of Xiao. (translated).

cells.content: 初王武元年。武，孝惠帝子，故壺關侯。
cells.literal: First year of King Wu. Wu was Emperor Xiaohui's son, former Marquis of Huguan.
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Wu. Wu was Emperor Xiaohui's son, former Marquis of Huguan. (translated).

cells.literal: First year of King Ze. Former Marquis of Yingling.
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Ze. Former Marquis of Yingling. (translated).

cells.literal: . Transferred to be King of Zhao, committed suicide. First year of King Lu Chan.
cells.idiomatic: . Transferred to be King of Zhao, committed suicide. First year of King Lu Chan. (translated).

cells.content: 呂產徙王梁。二月丁巳，王太元年。惠帝子。
cells.literal: Lu Chan transferred to be King of Liang. Second month, ding-si day, first year of King Tai. Emperor Hui's son.
cells.idiomatic: Lu Chan transferred to be King of Liang. Second month, ding-si day, first year of King Tai. Emperor Hui's son. (translated).

cells.content: 十月辛丑，初王呂通元年。肅王子，故東平侯。九月誅，國除。
cells.literal: Tenth month, xin-chou day, first year of King Lu Tong. King Su's son, former Marquis of Dongping. Executed in ninth month, kingdom abolished.
cells.idiomatic: Tenth month, xin-chou day, first year of King Lu Tong. King Su's son, former Marquis of Dongping. Executed in ninth month, kingdom abolished. (translated).

cells.content: 初王呂祿元年。呂后兄子，胡陵侯。誅，國除。
cells.literal: First year of King Lu Lu. Empress Lu's elder brother's son, Marquis of Huling. Executed, kingdom abolished.
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Lu Lu. Empress Lu's elder brother's son, Marquis of Huling. Executed, kingdom abolished. (translated).

cells.literal: Five. Not a legitimate son, executed, kingdom abolished and made into a commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Five. Not a legitimate son, executed, kingdom abolished and made into a commandery. (translated).

cells.literal: Two. Committed crime, executed, made into a commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Two. Committed crime, executed, made into a commandery. (translated).

cells.literal: Three. Executed by Wu, kingdom abolished.
cells.idiomatic: Three. Executed by Wu, kingdom abolished. (translated).

cells.literal: Nine. Deposed and made a marquis.
cells.idiomatic: Nine. Deposed and made a marquis. (translated).

cells.content: 十月庚戌，琅邪王澤徙燕元年。是為敬王。
cells.literal: Tenth month, geng-xu day, first year of Langye King Ze transferred to Yan. This was King Jing.
cells.idiomatic: Tenth month, geng-xu day, first year of Langye King Ze transferred to Yan. This was King Jing. (translated).

cells.content: 十月庚戌，趙王遂元年。幽王子。
cells.literal: Tenth month, geng-xu day, first year of King Zhao Sui. King You's son.
cells.idiomatic: Tenth month, geng-xu day, first year of King Zhao Sui. King You's son. (translated).

cells.literal: Divided into Hexian, capital at Lecheng.
cells.idiomatic: Divided into Hexian, capital at Lecheng. (translated).

cells.literal: Initially established Taiyuan, capital at Jinyang.
cells.idiomatic: Initially established Taiyuan, capital at Jinyang. (translated).

cells.literal: First year of King Yi Ying
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Yi Ying (translated).

cells.literal: First year of King Wen Ze
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Wen Ze (translated).

cells.content: 二月乙卯景王章元年。章，悼惠王子，故朱虛侯。
cells.literal: Second month, yi-mao day, first year of King Jing Zhang. Zhang was King Dao Hui's son, former Marquis of Zhuxu.
cells.idiomatic: Second month, yi-mao day, first year of King Jing Zhang. Zhang was King Dao Hui's son, former Marquis of Zhuxu. (translated).

cells.content: 二月乙卯，王興居元年。興居，悼惠王子，故東牟侯。
cells.literal: Second month, yi-mao day, first year of King Xingju. Xingju was King Dao Hui's son, former Marquis of Dongmu.
cells.idiomatic: Second month, yi-mao day, first year of King Xingju. Xingju was King Dao Hui's son, former Marquis of Dongmu. (translated).

cells.literal: Kingdom abolished and made into a commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Kingdom abolished and made into a commandery. (translated).

cells.content: 二月乙卯，初王文王辟強元年。辟強，趙幽王子。
cells.literal: Second month, yi-mao day, first year of King Wen Wang Piqiang. Piqiang was King Zhao You's son.
cells.idiomatic: Second month, yi-mao day, first year of King Wen Wang Piqiang. Piqiang was King Zhao You's son. (translated).

cells.content: 二月乙卯，初王參元年。參，文帝子。
cells.literal: Second month, yi-mao day, first year of King Shen. Shen was Emperor Wen's son.
cells.idiomatic: Second month, yi-mao day, first year of King Shen. Shen was Emperor Wen's son. (translated).

cells.content: 二月乙卯，初王懷王勝元年。勝，文帝子。
cells.literal: Second month, yi-mao day, first year of King Huai Wang Sheng. Sheng was Emperor Wen's son.
cells.idiomatic: Second month, yi-mao day, first year of King Huai Wang Sheng. Sheng was Emperor Wen's son. (translated).

cells.content: 二月乙卯，初王武元年。武，文帝子。
cells.literal: Second month, yi-mao day, first year of King Wu. Wu was Emperor Wen's son.
cells.idiomatic: Second month, yi-mao day, first year of King Wu. Wu was Emperor Wen's son. (translated).

cells.literal: First year of King Kang Jia
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Kang Jia (translated).

cells.literal: First year of King Jing Zhu
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Jing Zhu (translated).

cells.literal: First year of King Gong Xi
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Gong Xi (translated).

cells.literal: Three. Changed to become King of Dai.
cells.idiomatic: Three. Changed to become King of Dai. (translated).

cells.literal: Dai King Wu transferred to Huaiyang for three years.
cells.idiomatic: Dai King Wu transferred to Huaiyang for three years. (translated).

cells.content: 三。太原王參更號為代王三年，實居太原，是為孝王。
cells.literal: Three. Taiyuan King Shen changed title to Dai King for three years, actually resided in Taiyuan, this was King Xiao.
cells.idiomatic: Three. Taiyuan King Shen changed title to Dai King for three years, actually resided in Taiyuan, this was King Xiao. (translated).

cells.content: 二十三。王無道，遷蜀，死雍，為郡。
cells.literal: Twenty-three. King was unrighteous, banished to Shu, died in Yong, made into a commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-three. King was unrighteous, banished to Shu, died in Yong, made into a commandery. (translated).

cells.literal: Eight. Transferred to Huainan. Made into a commandery, subordinate to Qi.
cells.idiomatic: Eight. Transferred to Huainan. Made into a commandery, subordinate to Qi. (translated).

cells.literal: Ten. Came to court. Died, no heirs.
cells.idiomatic: Ten. Came to court. Died, no heirs. (translated).

cells.literal: Ten. Came to court. Transferred to Liang. Made into a commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Ten. Came to court. Transferred to Liang. Made into a commandery. (translated).

cells.literal: First year of Chengyang King Xi transferred to Huainan
cells.idiomatic: First year of Chengyang King Xi transferred to Huainan (translated).

cells.content: 十一。淮陽王武徙梁年，是為孝王。
cells.literal: Eleven. Year Huaiyang King Wu transferred to Liang, this was King Xiao.
cells.idiomatic: Eleven. Year Huaiyang King Wu transferred to Liang, this was King Xiao. (translated).

cells.literal: Divided into Zichuan, capital at Ju.
cells.idiomatic: Divided into Zichuan, capital at Ju. (translated).

cells.literal: Divided into Jiaoxi, capital at Wan.
cells.idiomatic: Divided into Jiaoxi, capital at Wan. (translated).

cells.literal: Divided into Jiaodong, capital at Jimo.
cells.idiomatic: Divided into Jiaodong, capital at Jimo. (translated).

cells.content: 哀王福元年。薨，無後，國除為郡。
cells.literal: First year of King Ai Fu. Died, no heirs, kingdom abolished as commandery.
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Ai Fu. Died, no heirs, kingdom abolished as commandery. (translated).

cells.content: 四月丙寅，王勃元年。淮南厲王子，故安陽侯。
cells.literal: Fourth month, bingyin day, first year of King Bo. Son of King Li of Huainan, formerly Marquis of Anyang.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month, bingyin day, first year of King Bo. Son of King Li of Huainan, formerly Marquis of Anyang. (translated).

cells.content: 四月丙寅，孝王將閭元年。齊悼惠王子，故陽虛侯。
cells.literal: Fourth month, bingyin day, first year of King Xiao Jianglü. Son of King Daohui of Qi, formerly Marquis of Yangxu.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month, bingyin day, first year of King Xiao Jianglü. Son of King Daohui of Qi, formerly Marquis of Yangxu. (translated).

cells.content: 淮南王喜徙城陽十三年。
cells.literal: Thirteenth year of Huainan King Xi transferred to Chengyang.
cells.idiomatic: Thirteenth year of Huainan King Xi transferred to Chengyang. (translated).

cells.content: 四月丙寅，初王志元年。齊悼惠王子，故安都侯。
cells.literal: Fourth month, bingyin day, first year of King Zhi. Son of King Daohui of Qi, formerly Marquis of Andu.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month, bingyin day, first year of King Zhi. Son of King Daohui of Qi, formerly Marquis of Andu. (translated).

cells.content: 四月丙寅，初王辟光元年。齊悼惠王子，故扐侯。
cells.literal: Fourth month, bingyin day, first year of King Piguang. Son of King Daohui of Qi, formerly Marquis of Xun.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month, bingyin day, first year of King Piguang. Son of King Daohui of Qi, formerly Marquis of Xun. (translated).

cells.content: 四月丙寅，初王賢元年。齊悼惠王子，故武城侯。
cells.literal: Fourth month, bingyin day, first year of King Xian. Son of King Daohui of Qi, formerly Marquis of Wucheng.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month, bingyin day, first year of King Xian. Son of King Daohui of Qi, formerly Marquis of Wucheng. (translated).

cells.content: 四月丙寅，初王卬元年。齊悼惠王子，故平昌侯。
cells.literal: Fourth month, bingyin day, first year of King Ang. Son of King Daohui of Qi, formerly Marquis of Pingchang.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month, bingyin day, first year of King Ang. Son of King Daohui of Qi, formerly Marquis of Pingchang. (translated).

cells.content: 四月丙寅，初王雄渠元年。齊悼惠王子，故白石侯。
cells.literal: Fourth month, bingyin day, first year of King Xiongqu. Son of King Daohui of Qi, formerly Marquis of Baishi.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month, bingyin day, first year of King Xiongqu. Son of King Daohui of Qi, formerly Marquis of Baishi. (translated).

cells.content: 四月丙寅，王安元年。淮南厲王子，故阜陵侯。
cells.literal: Fourth month, bingyin day, first year of King An. Son of King Li of Huainan, formerly Marquis of Fuling.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month, bingyin day, first year of King An. Son of King Li of Huainan, formerly Marquis of Fuling. (translated).

cells.content: 四月丙寅，王賜元年。淮南厲王子，故陽周侯。
cells.literal: Fourth month, bingyin day, first year of King Ci. Son of King Li of Huainan, formerly Marquis of Yangzhou.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month, bingyin day, first year of King Ci. Son of King Li of Huainan, formerly Marquis of Yangzhou. (translated).

cells.literal: First year of King Gong Deng
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Gong Deng (translated).

cells.content: 二十一。來朝。薨，無後，國除。
cells.literal: Twenty-one. Came to court. Died, no heirs, kingdom abolished.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-one. Came to court. Died, no heirs, kingdom abolished. (translated).

cells.literal: First year of Emperor Xiao Jing
cells.idiomatic: First year of Emperor Xiao Jing (translated).

cells.literal: Initially established Guangchuan, capital at Xindu.
cells.idiomatic: Initially established Guangchuan, capital at Xindu. (translated).

cells.literal: Initially established Linjiang, capital at Jiangling.
cells.idiomatic: Initially established Linjiang, capital at Jiangling. (translated).

cells.literal: Divided Chu and restored Lu kingdom.
cells.idiomatic: Divided Chu and restored Lu kingdom. (translated).

cells.content: 三月甲寅，初王獻王德元年。景帝子。
cells.literal: Third month, jiayin day, first year of King Xian Wangde. Son of Emperor Jing.
cells.idiomatic: Third month, jiayin day, first year of King Xian Wangde. Son of Emperor Jing. (translated).

cells.content: 三月甲寅，王彭祖元年。景帝子。
cells.literal: Third month, jiayin day, first year of King Pengzu. Son of Emperor Jing.
cells.idiomatic: Third month, jiayin day, first year of King Pengzu. Son of Emperor Jing. (translated).

cells.literal: Initially established Zhongshan, capital at Lunu.
cells.idiomatic: Initially established Zhongshan, capital at Lunu. (translated).

cells.content: 三月甲寅，初王閼于元年。景帝子。
cells.literal: Third month, jiayin day, first year of King Yanyu. Son of Emperor Jing.
cells.idiomatic: Third month, jiayin day, first year of King Yanyu. Son of Emperor Jing. (translated).

cells.content: 三月甲寅，初王非元年。景帝子。
cells.literal: Third month, jiayin day, first year of King Fei. Son of Emperor Jing.
cells.idiomatic: Third month, jiayin day, first year of King Fei. Son of Emperor Jing. (translated).

cells.content: 三月甲寅，初王餘元年，景帝子。
cells.literal: Third month, jiayin day, first year of King Yu. Son of Emperor Jing.
cells.idiomatic: Third month, jiayin day, first year of King Yu. Son of Emperor Jing. (translated).

cells.content: 三月甲寅，定王發元年。景帝子。
cells.literal: Third month, jiayin day, first year of King Ding Fa. Son of Emperor Jing.
cells.idiomatic: Third month, jiayin day, first year of King Ding Fa. Son of Emperor Jing. (translated).

cells.content: 六月乙亥淮陽王徙魯元年。是為恭王。
cells.literal: Sixth month, yihai day, first year of Huaiyang King transferred to Lu. This was King Gong.
cells.idiomatic: Sixth month, yihai day, first year of Huaiyang King transferred to Lu. This was King Gong. (translated).

cells.literal: Eleven. Rebelled, executed. Became a commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Eleven. Rebelled, executed. Became a commandery. (translated).

cells.content: 十一。反，誅。濟北王志徙菑川十一年。是為懿王。
cells.literal: Eleven. Rebelled, executed. Jibei King Zhi transferred to Zichuan eleven years. This was King Yi.
cells.idiomatic: Eleven. Rebelled, executed. Jibei King Zhi transferred to Zichuan eleven years. This was King Yi. (translated).

cells.content: 十一。反，誅。六月乙亥，于王端元年。景帝子。
cells.literal: Eleven. Rebelled, executed. Sixth month, yihai day, first year of King Yu Duan. Son of Emperor Jing.
cells.idiomatic: Eleven. Rebelled, executed. Sixth month, yihai day, first year of King Yu Duan. Son of Emperor Jing. (translated).

cells.literal: Twenty-six. Rebelled, executed. Became a commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-six. Rebelled, executed. Became a commandery. (translated).

cells.content: 六月乙亥，靖王勝元年。景帝子。
cells.literal: Sixth month, yihai day, first year of King Jing Sheng. Son of Emperor Jing.
cells.idiomatic: Sixth month, yihai day, first year of King Jing Sheng. Son of Emperor Jing. (translated).

cells.literal: Transferred to Lu. Became a commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Transferred to Lu. Became a commandery. (translated).

cells.literal: Four. Fourth month, jisi day, established crown prince
cells.idiomatic: Four. Fourth month, jisi day, established crown prince (translated).

cells.content: 文王禮元年。元王子，故平陸侯。
cells.literal: First year of King Wen Li. Son of Emperor Yuan, formerly Marquis of Pinglu.
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Wen Li. Son of Emperor Yuan, formerly Marquis of Pinglu. (translated).

cells.content: 十二。徙濟北。廬江王賜徙衡山元年。
cells.literal: Twelve. Transferred to Jibei. First year of Lujiang King Ci transferred to Hengshan.
cells.idiomatic: Twelve. Transferred to Jibei. First year of Lujiang King Ci transferred to Hengshan. (translated).

cells.literal: First year of King Yi Shou
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Yi Shou (translated).

cells.content: 衡山王勃徙濟北十二年。是為貞王。
cells.literal: Twelfth year of Hengshan King Bo transferred to Jibei. This was King Zhen.
cells.idiomatic: Twelfth year of Hengshan King Bo transferred to Jibei. This was King Zhen. (translated).

cells.content: 四月己巳，初王元年。是為孝武帝。
cells.literal: Fourth month, jisi day, first year of King Chu. This was Emperor Xiaowu.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month, jisi day, first year of King Chu. This was Emperor Xiaowu. (translated).

cells.content: 初置江都。六月乙亥，汝南王非為江都王元年。是為易王。
cells.literal: Initially established Jiangdu. Sixth month, yihai day, first year of Runan King Fei as King of Jiangdu. This was King Yi.
cells.idiomatic: Initially established Jiangdu. Sixth month, yihai day, first year of Runan King Fei as King of Jiangdu. This was King Yi. (translated).

cells.literal: Twelve. Transferred to Hengshan, kingdom abolished as commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Twelve. Transferred to Hengshan, kingdom abolished as commandery. (translated).

cells.literal: Three. Died, no heirs, kingdom abolished as commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Three. Died, no heirs, kingdom abolished as commandery. (translated).

cells.content: 廣川王彭祖徙趙四年。是為敬肅王。
cells.literal: Fourth year of Guangchuan King Pengzu transferred to Zhao. This was King Jingsu.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth year of Guangchuan King Pengzu transferred to Zhao. This was King Jingsu. (translated).

cells.literal: Four. Transferred to Zhao, kingdom abolished as Xindu commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Four. Transferred to Zhao, kingdom abolished as Xindu commandery. (translated).

cells.literal: First year of King Wu Hu
cells.idiomatic: First year of King Wu Hu (translated).

cells.literal: Seven. Eleventh month, day of yi-chou, crown prince deposed.
cells.idiomatic: Seven. Eleventh month, day of yi-chou, crown prince deposed. (translated).

cells.literal: Four. Fourth month, day of ding-si, became crown prince.
cells.idiomatic: Four. Fourth month, day of ding-si, became crown prince. (translated).

cells.content: 十一月乙丑，初王閔王榮元年。景帝太子，廢。
cells.literal: Eleventh month, day of yi-chou, first king Minwang Rong first year. Jingdi crown prince, deposed.
cells.idiomatic: Eleventh month, day of yi-chou, first king Minwang Rong first year. Jingdi crown prince, deposed. (translated).

cells.content: 四月乙巳，初王康王寄元年。景帝子。
cells.literal: Fourth month, yi-si day, first king Kang Wang Ji first year. Jingdi's son.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month, yi-si day, first king Kang Wang Ji first year. Jingdi's son. (translated).

cells.content: 四月乙巳，惠王越元年。景帝子。
cells.literal: Fourth month, yi-si day, Hui Wang Yue first year. Jingdi's son.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month, yi-si day, Hui Wang Yue first year. Jingdi's son. (translated).

cells.content: 三月丁巳，哀王乘元年。景帝子。
cells.literal: Third month, ding-si day, Ai Wang Cheng first year. Jingdi's son.
cells.idiomatic: Third month, ding-si day, Ai Wang Cheng first year. Jingdi's son. (translated).

cells.content: 四。坐侵廟壖垣為宮，自殺。國除為南郡。
cells.literal: Four. Convicted of encroaching on temple precinct walls to build palace, committed suicide. Kingdom abolished and made Nanhun commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Four. Convicted of encroaching on temple precinct walls to build palace, committed suicide. Kingdom abolished and made Nanhun commandery. (translated).

cells.content: 四月丁巳，初王憲王舜元年。孝景子。
cells.literal: Fourth month, ding-si day, first king Xian Wang Shun first year. Xiaojing's son.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month, ding-si day, first king Xian Wang Shun first year. Xiaojing's son. (translated).

cells.content: 五月丙戌，初王明元年。梁孝王子。
cells.literal: Fifth month, bing-xu day, first king Ming first year. Liang Xiaowang's son.
cells.idiomatic: Fifth month, bing-xu day, first king Ming first year. Liang Xiaowang's son. (translated).

cells.content: 五月丙戌，初王彭離元年。梁孝王子。
cells.literal: Fifth month, bing-xu day, first king Pengli first year. Liang Xiaowang's son.
cells.idiomatic: Fifth month, bing-xu day, first king Pengli first year. Liang Xiaowang's son. (translated).

cells.content: 五月丙戌，初王定元年。梁孝王子。
cells.literal: Fifth month, bing-xu day, first king Ding first year. Liang Xiaowang's son.
cells.idiomatic: Fifth month, bing-xu day, first king Ding first year. Liang Xiaowang's son. (translated).

cells.content: 五月丙戌，初王不識元年。梁孝王子。
cells.literal: Fifth month, bing-xu day, first king Bushi first year. Liang Xiaowang's son.
cells.idiomatic: Fifth month, bing-xu day, first king Bushi first year. Liang Xiaowang's son. (translated).

cells.literal: King Gong Mai first year. Xiaowang's son.
cells.idiomatic: King Gong Mai first year. Xiaowang's son. (translated).

cells.literal: Two. Died, no heirs, kingdom abolished.
cells.idiomatic: Two. Died, no heirs, kingdom abolished. (translated).

cells.literal: Seven. Clearly killed the tutor. Deposed and banished to Fangling.
cells.idiomatic: Seven. Clearly killed the tutor. Deposed and banished to Fangling. (translated).

cells.literal: Twelve. Died, no heirs, kingdom abolished and became commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Twelve. Died, no heirs, kingdom abolished and became commandery. (translated).

cells.literal: Nine. Died, no heirs, kingdom abolished and became commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Nine. Died, no heirs, kingdom abolished and became commandery. (translated).

cells.literal: Li King Ci Chang first year.
cells.idiomatic: Li King Ci Chang first year. (translated).

cells.literal: Gong Wang Bu Hai first year.
cells.idiomatic: Gong Wang Bu Hai first year. (translated).

cells.content: 二十四。坐禽獸行自殺。國除為郡。
cells.literal: Twenty-four. Committed suicide for beastly behavior. Kingdom abolished and became commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-four. Committed suicide for beastly behavior. Kingdom abolished and became commandery. (translated).

cells.literal: Five. Died, no heirs, kingdom abolished and became commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Five. Died, no heirs, kingdom abolished and became commandery. (translated).

cells.content: 四十一。安有罪，削國二縣。
cells.literal: Forty-one. An had crime, kingdom reduced by two counties.
cells.idiomatic: Forty-one. An had crime, kingdom reduced by two counties. (translated).

cells.literal: Thirty-two. Rebelled, committed suicide, kingdom abolished.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-two. Rebelled, committed suicide, kingdom abolished. (translated).

cells.content: 七。反，自殺，國除為廣陵郡。
cells.literal: Seven. Rebelled, committed suicide, kingdom abolished and became Guangling commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Seven. Rebelled, committed suicide, kingdom abolished and became Guangling commandery. (translated).

cells.content: 置六安國，以故陳為都。七月丙子。初王恭王慶元年。膠東王子。
cells.literal: Established Liu'an kingdom, using former Chen as capital. Seventh month bingzi day. Initially enfeoffed Gong Wang Qing first year. Jiaodong prince.
cells.idiomatic: Established Liu'an kingdom, using former Chen as capital. Seventh month bingzi day. Initially enfeoffed Gong Wang Qing first year. Jiaodong prince. (translated).

cells.content: 四月乙巳，初王懷王閎元年。武帝子。
cells.literal: Fourth month yisi day, initially enfeoffed Huai Wang Hong first year. Wu Emperor's son.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month yisi day, initially enfeoffed Huai Wang Hong first year. Wu Emperor's son. (translated).

cells.content: 四月乙巳，初王胥元年。武帝子。
cells.literal: Fourth month yisi day, initially enfeoffed Xu first year. Wu Emperor's son.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month yisi day, initially enfeoffed Xu first year. Wu Emperor's son. (translated).

cells.content: 四月乙巳，初王剌王旦元年。武帝子。
cells.literal: Fourth month yisi day, initially enfeoffed La Wang Dan first year. Wu Emperor's son.
cells.idiomatic: Fourth month yisi day, initially enfeoffed La Wang Dan first year. Wu Emperor's son. (translated).

cells.content: 二十九。剽攻殺人，遷上庸，國為大河郡。
cells.literal: Twenty-nine. Robbed, attacked and killed people, banished to Shangyong, kingdom became Dahe commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-nine. Robbed, attacked and killed people, banished to Shangyong, kingdom became Dahe commandery. (translated).

cells.literal: Initially established Sishui, capital at Tan.
cells.idiomatic: Initially established Sishui, capital at Tan. (translated).

cells.literal: Nineteen. Moved to Qinghe. Became Taiyuan commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Nineteen. Moved to Qinghe. Became Taiyuan commandery. (translated).

cells.content: 思王商元年。商，常山憲王子。
cells.literal: Si Wang Shang first year. Shang, Changshan Xian Wang's son.
cells.idiomatic: Si Wang Shang first year. Shang, Changshan Xian Wang's son. (translated).

cells.content: 二十。代王義徙清河年。是為剛王。
cells.literal: Twenty. Year when Dai Wang Yi moved to Qinghe. This became Gang Wang.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty. Year when Dai Wang Yi moved to Qinghe. This became Gang Wang. (translated).

cells.content: 更為真定國。頃王平元年。常山憲王子。
cells.literal: Changed to Zhending kingdom. Qing Wang Ping first year. Changshan Xian Wang's son.
cells.idiomatic: Changed to Zhending kingdom. Qing Wang Ping first year. Changshan Xian Wang's son. (translated).

cells.literal: Ai Wang Chang first year. Died that same year.
cells.idiomatic: Ai Wang Chang first year. Died that same year. (translated).

cells.literal: Kang Wang Kun Chi first year.
cells.idiomatic: Kang Wang Kun Chi first year. (translated).

cells.literal: Eight. Died, no heirs, kingdom abolished and became commandery.
cells.idiomatic: Eight. Died, no heirs, kingdom abolished and became commandery. (translated).

cells.literal: Forty-seven. Died, no heirs, kingdom abolished.
cells.idiomatic: Forty-seven. Died, no heirs, kingdom abolished. (translated).

cells.literal: Twenty-three. Went to court at Taishan.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-three. Went to court at Taishan. (translated).

cells.literal: Forty-six. Went to court at Taishan.
cells.idiomatic: Forty-six. Went to court at Taishan. (translated).

cells.literal: Dai Wang Tong Ping first year.
cells.idiomatic: Dai Wang Tong Ping first year. (translated).

cells.content: 哀王安世元年。即戴王賀元年。安世子。
cells.literal: Ai Wang An Shi first year. That is Dai Wang He first year. An Shi's son.
cells.idiomatic: Ai Wang An Shi first year. That is Dai Wang He first year. An Shi's son. (translated).
